info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 2 at 6:23AM MST until June 2 at 9:15AM MST by NWS Flagstaff AZ
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...From Cordes Junction to Black Canyon City, for a portion of west central Arizona, including the following county, Yavapai.
* WHEN...Until 915 AM MST.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in creeks and normally dry washes is imminent or occurring. Dangerous flooding over low-water crossings.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 618 AM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to slow moving thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.75 and 1.25 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Castle Creek, Humbug Creek, Black Canyon Creek, the Agua Fria River, and Sycamore Creek. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Sunset Point Rest Area, Agua Fria National Monument, Black Canyon City, Cordes Lakes, Horse Thief Basin, Spring Valley, Humbug Bay, Coles Bay, Mayer, Castle Hot Springs, Goose Bay, Lake Pleasant, Castle Creek Boat Ramp, Cottonwood Day Use Area, Sunset Mountain, Chalk Mountain, Bumble Bee, Rock Springs, Castle Creek Wilderness and Cordes Junction. - This includes the following recreation areas and campgrounds... Turney Gulch Group Campground, Hazlett Hollow Campground and Black Canyon Campground.
This includes the following highways... State Route 69 between mile markers 263 and 270. Interstate 17 between mile markers 242 and 266. - Additional information is available at weather.gov/flagstaff.
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 AM MST THIS MORNING
